data.body:
1. Open settings.json, have an error anywhere
2. Trigger intelli-sense -> notice that you only get "language specific editor settings" as a suggestion. Why does the error on top influence what suggestions I get

data.title: Representation of regex in JSON
data.body:
This is a follow up on https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27486#issuecomment-304892062 which is about having support for the word-regex in `xyz.language-configuration.json`-files. There we have `{pattern:string; flags:string}` or just a string and in the problem matcher definition of the task framework we have `{regexp:string; ...}`.

Since both seem different and since problem matchers are already shipped we should consider aligning the language configuration.

Need support for CSS3 grid layout in SCSS/CSS Linter

data.title: Inconsistent use of ProblemMatcher
data.body: We `ProblemMatcher` is actually just a string or string-array. We accept problem matchers when creating task, tho the property `...Task#problemMatcher` is only type `string[]`. I'd suggestion to nuke `ProblemMatcher` and to clearly document that it's problem match ids

data.title: 'Occurred' is misspelled at multiple places

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
There are 9 occurrences or 'occured' in our repo. The correct spelling is 'occurred'.
http://www.gingersoftware.com/english-online/spelling-book/misspelling/occurred-occured-ocurred

Same for 'occured' (1 misspelling) and 'Occurences' (65 misspellings)

data.title: Fold Shell and Process task?
data.body:
For the sake of simplify I would like start a discussion about folding `ShellTask` and `ProcessTask`. The following things confuse me:

* A `TaskProvider` must return a `Task` but I cannot instantiate a `Task` and I have to know that a Task is an or-type
* Shell and process task have 7 identical properties and only differ in `process` vs `commandLine` and in `options`, which again have quite some overlap
* My understanding is that a ShellTask should also be able to execute a process
* Does a ShellTask run in the terminal and does a process task "run" in an output channel or both run in a terminal?

data.title: Vertical scroll in vscode not work properly after the suspension . It is not smooth, it jumps

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:
1.12.2
- OS Version:
Windows 10

System: Dell Inspiron 5000, i5 7200u

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Suspend Windows 10
2. Start Windows 10
3. Vertical scroll in vscode not work properly. It is not smooth, it jumps
4.  Reduce windows size
5. Maximize the windows, and the problem is solved.

data.title: merge conflict: Error in console when opening compare
data.body:
Testing #27549

- create a file as described in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27288#issuecomment-304138928
- open the dev tools
- click on 'Compare Changes' 

Console says:
`[Extension Host] An error occured while running command merge-conflict.compare TextEditor disposed`

data.title: Merge Conflict: Console output after merging

- create a file as described in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27288#issuecomment-304138928
- open the dev tools
- resolve the merge conflic by accepting the incoming change

Console says:
`[Extension Host] Edits from command merge-conflict.accept.incoming were not applied.`

data.title: strict property missing in jsconfig.json schema
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add `"checkJs": true` in `jsconfig.json` > type checking is working and json is OK
2. Add `"strict": true` in `jsconfig.json` > strict type checking is working but json is warned as invalid as `strict` property is missing in `jsconfig.json` schema.

I can manage the PR, but I didn't found the file (I just found the one with the default values, but not the schema itself).

data.title: Align [Shell|Process]Task#identifier
data.body: I have still not understood why we have `#identifier` in shell and process task and it still feels like we are leaking an implementation detail but if we do so it should  be called `id` to align with `Extension#id` and `SourceControl#id`

data.title: Unspecific names: TerminalBehaviour and RevealKind
data.body: Unsure of alternatives but I didn't expect `TerminalBehaviour` to belong to tasks but to the terminal API, also `RevealKind` is very generic and can be confused with other parts, like editor selection reveal kind

data.body:

- open the task.json and change the version to '2.0.0'
- open command palette and try to run a task.

This is what I get, I would have expected the gulp tasks and the package.json scripts

data.title: Don't mention VS Code in jsdoc
data.body: We don't mention product names in this repo, say something like 'the editor'

data.title: Streamline Tasks
data.body:
Both tasks `ShellTask` and `TerminalTask` use a happy mix of `readonly`, `xyz | undefined` type declarations, and non JS-ish defaults. I'd recommend to clarify things, e.g

* Use question mark for types that can be undefined, e.g `CompletionItem#insertText`
* Don't use `readonly` the model is anyway that VS Code created a disconnected copy of that data providers return
* Don't use empty defaults like an empty array or empty object. The JavaScript programmer expects `undefined`

data.title: Too many new actions just for merging
data.body:
Refs: #27549

We are introducing 10 new actions just for merging. These actions now always show up in the command palette even though if I am never in a merge conflict.
Until we have a better story of not showing actions based on condition in the command palette I would be carefull about introducing 10 new actions

fyi @bpasero 

![screen shot 2017-05-30 at 16 07 45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/26587296/2f095db2-4552-11e7-92e4-7040929c0e7c.png)

I wrote `"type": "shell"`. I don't get any intellisense suggestions for a shell property?

data.title: Merge conflict: stale update of decorations with multiple editors
data.body:
Refs: #27549

1. Have a merge conflict and open it in two editors side by side
2. Click on any of the accept actions -> notice how the decoration is only updated in one editor, and only when focus changed in the other editor

This can be especially anoying with the comination of undo and multiple editors
It seems like in the git merge conflicts we are listening on wrong events

![stale](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/26587075/8f78bbda-4551-11e7-86ca-5a548c3e2b9b.gif)

data.title: Merge conflict action titles should have upper case start of word
data.body:
Refs: #27549

Notice how all our UI elements have the first case of a letter in upper case. This is not the case with the merge conflict actions. I would expect these actions to follow our conventations through the workbench.

![screen shot 2017-05-30 at 15 55 55](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/26586765/7a368438-4550-11e7-9d5d-4fa410f56eab.png)
